name: Trainnotifier.co.uk
body:
### About
This project is aimed at using the [Network Rail Data Feeds](https://datafeeds.networkrail.co.uk/) to help learn some new technologies through an area I am interested in. 
I originally intended to do something with the Live Departure Board Web Service until National Rail made it pay-only. 
This site should not be relied on as an accurate source, although the data comes from Network Rail, I cannot guarantee the site will have interpreted the data correctly.

### Web Client Technologies Used
The web client uses:
* HTML 5 based around [bootstrap](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/)
* Theme from [Bootswatch](http://bootswatch.com/)
* [jQuery](http://jquery.com/)
* [knockout](http://knockoutjs.com/)
* [Google Maps API](https://developers.google.com/maps/)
* [Windows Azure](https://www.windowsazure.com/en-us/) [Web Sites](https://www.windowsazure.com/en-us/home/scenarios/web-sites/)

### Server Technologies Used
The server side uses:
* [Alchemy Websockets](http://alchemywebsockets.net/) to handle websocket connections
* [Apache NMS](http://activemq.apache.org/nms/) Stomp (slighlty modified) to connect to the rail data feeds
* ASP.NET MVC Web API for serving data to the web client
* SQL Server 2008 R2

### In Use
This site has two URLs.
* (http://www.trainnotifier.co.uk) - this is fully hosted on a Windows Azure Virtual Machine and uses Azure SQL as a backend. This is updated when features have been tested on the site below.
* (http://trainnotifier.azurewebsites.net) - this is hosted on the free Windows Web Sites tier. The backend runs off my own HP Microserver. This is auto-updated from github.

### About me
I started to do similar stuff years ago (dating back to 2005) using the BBC backstage data to generate a google maps web app and google earth feeds. 
This website is still available but doesnt really work any more, see [http://bbc.blueghost.co.uk](http://bbc.blueghost.co.uk)

### Thanks
Thanks should go to Network Rail for releasing this data, and for the community who helped get them to release it. 
See [the wiki](http://wiki.openraildata.info) for more info. 
Thanks should also go to Jonathan Brown who originally gave me a list of national rail stations and lat/lon values that I imported into a MySQL database in 2005, sadly the link to the discussion on the Keyhole BBS boards is now broke. I intent to update the list at some point using the open data now available.

### Contact
You can contact me on twitter [@blueghostuk](https://twitter.com/blueghostuk) or [@trainnotifier](https://twitter.com/trainnotifier)
